page.title: 09VENTNOR BREWERY.
page.content: Burt's Brewery has belonged to the Philips family since 1906. The present brewery was built after the original was bombed during the War. Local spring water provides the liquor for the beer-making process. Malted barley comes from Stowmarket, Suffolk. The liquid sugar comes from Manchester and the hops come from Kent. Yeast is the other ingredient. In the summer about 7,200 gallons are brewed a week. The beer is kept in vats for 5 days. 12 people work at the brewery and they start work at 6 am. They make 2 kinds of draught beer and 4 kinds of bottled beer. The brewery owns 11 public houses and 2 shops. They have about 200 other customers including 3 on the mainland. The brewery won awards in the 1960's and recently featured on the T.V. programme 'The Islanders'.
